questions.explanation: Placards must be placed on the front, the rear, and both sides of a vehicle carrying hazardous cargo. They must be readable from any direction.

questions.question: When changing lanes, turn signals:
questions.answerB: Should only be used if a vehicle is close to you.
questions.explanation: Always signal your intentions before turning or changing lanes. Do not assume that other drivers will move out of your way simply because you are signaling to turn.

questions.question: When pulled off on the side of the road:
questions.answerA: A driver should keep the driver’s side door open.
questions.answerB: A driver should turn on the emergency flashers.
questions.answerC: The driver should wave their arms.
questions.explanation: If you must stop on the side of the road, make sure to use your four-way emergency flashers. This is particularly important at night.

questions.question: One way to prevent drowsiness while driving is to:
questions.answerC: Get adequate sleep the night before the trip.
questions.explanation: Driving while fatigued can be extremely dangerous. Strategies for preventing drowsiness while driving include getting a full night's sleep before a trip; having someone ride with you; scheduling trips for times during which you are normally awake; and avoiding medications that may cause drowsiness. Exercising regularly can increase your energy levels and make you less likely to become tired while driving.

questions.question: What should you do if the braking system cannot build up hydraulic pressure?
questions.answerC: Hold the brake pedal down as far as it will go.
questions.explanation: If your hydraulic braking system will not build up the pressure needed to slow or stop your vehicle, there are a few possible solutions. Try shifting into a lower gear, pumping the brakes, and/or using the emergency brake.

questions.question: If approaching a railroad crossing that is being approached by a train, you should:
questions.answerA: Try to cross the tracks quickly.
questions.answerC: Stop and wait for the train to pass before beginning across the tracks.
questions.explanation: Never attempt to beat a train to a railroad crossing. It is very difficult to accurately judge the speed of an approaching train. If you come upon a crossing that is being approached by a train, you must stop and wait for the train to pass before you attempt to cross the tracks.

questions.question: When performing a pre-trip inspection and looking into the fifth wheel gap, you should:
questions.answerA: Make sure the locking jaws are open.
questions.answerB: Make sure the locking jaws are fully closed around the kingpin.
questions.answerC: Make sure the locking jaws are loose.
questions.explanation: When inspecting a trailer coupling, you should make sure the fifth wheel locking jaws are closed around the shank of the kingpin, not the head of the kingpin.

questions.question: How can you check for a leak in hydraulic brakes?
questions.answerA: Pump the brake pedal three times, then hold down the pedal for five seconds. If the pedal moves, there may be a problem.
questions.answerB: Push the brake pedal down as far as possible and release. If the brake pedal returns to its normal position, there may be a problem.
questions.answerC: Push the brake pedal down as far as possible and release. If the brake squeaks, there may be a problem.
questions.explanation: Check hydraulic brakes by pumping the brake pedal three times before applying firm pressure to the pedal for five seconds. The pedal should not move. If it does, there may be a leak or some other problem in the braking system.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best advice for driving in fog?
questions.answerA: Try not to drive in fog.
questions.explanation: Driving in fog is always dangerous and should be avoided entirely if at all possible. If you must drive in fog, be sure to turn on your low beam headlights and fog lights, even during the daytime.

questions.question: If involved in an accident, which of the following is not recommended?
questions.answerA: Trying to move your vehicle to the side of the road
questions.explanation: When involved in an accident, you should protect the area, notify authorities, care for the injured, collect required information, and report the accident. You can lose your license for leaving the scene of an accident.

questions.question: A person driving with an open window in cold weather may be:
questions.answerB: A person who is dressed inappropriately.
questions.answerC: A person who likes fresh air.
questions.explanation: It is important to observe other drivers' actions and identify clues that a person could be driving impaired. Drivers who have had too much to drink, are sleepy, are on drugs, or are ill can present hazards to other drivers. One sign that a driver may be impaired is that they have their windows rolled down in cold weather.

questions.question: Eating while driving:
questions.answerA: Is a good way to maximize your time.
questions.answerC: Is a distraction to the driver.
questions.explanation: Eating while driving can be a dangerous distraction to the driver both because it diverts their attention away from the task at hand and requires them to remove a hand from the steering wheel.

questions.question: Shortly after a tire has been changed, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop to make sure the lug nuts are still tight.
questions.explanation: After a tire has been changed, you should stop a short while later to recheck the tightness of the lug nuts.

questions.question: When should a driver sign a vehicle inspection report?
questions.explanation: You must sign a vehicle inspection report only if defects were noted and either certified to have been repaired or certified as not needing to be repaired.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle gets stuck on railroad tracks?
questions.answerB: Get out of the vehicle and call for assistance.
questions.answerC: Continue trying to get your vehicle off the tracks until you are successful.
questions.explanation: If your CMV gets stuck on railroad tracks, you should immediately leave the vehicle and get away from the tracks. Check the signposts or signal housing at the crossing for emergency contact information and call 911, or another appropriate emergency number.

questions.question: When turning, when should the turn signal be canceled?
questions.explanation: Always signal continuously through a turn. Do not cancel a signal until the turn is finished.

questions.question: To stay alert while driving, you should:
questions.answerA: Eat a heavy meal before beginning your trip.
questions.answerC: Ride with a second person who can share driving responsibilities.
questions.explanation: Splitting driving responsibilities with a second driver lowers the chance that either of you will drive while fatigued. You can also reduce the risk of fatigue by avoiding heavy foods and keeping the interior of the cab cool.

questions.question: If your brakes fail when traveling downhill, decide what to do as quickly as possible because:
questions.answerA: The longer you wait, the faster your vehicle will go.
questions.answerB: The longer you wait, the more vehicles will get out of your way.
questions.answerC: The longer you wait, the slower your vehicle will go.
questions.explanation: However you choose to deal with a brake failure on a downhill slope, it is important that you make your decision as quickly as possible. The longer you wait to act, the faster your vehicle will be moving, and the harder it will become to stop.

questions.question: To prevent a vehicle from rolling backward when beginning to move forward from a stopped position, you should:
questions.explanation: To prevent a vehicle with manual transmission from rolling backward when you begin to move forward from a stopped position, you can partly engage the clutch before removing your foot from the brake pedal.

questions.question: What is brake lag?
questions.answerA: The time required for the brakes to work after the brake pedal is pressed
questions.answerB: The distance between the brake pedal and the floor
questions.answerC: The amount of air pressure used to stop the vehicle
questions.explanation: Because air takes time to flow through the air lines to the brakes, air brakes cannot begin working instantly. There is often a brake lag of at least one-half of a second between the moment the brake pedal is pressed and the moment the brakes begin to work.

questions.question: The air storage tanks:
questions.answerA: Hold only enough air for one braking cycle.
questions.answerB: Hold enough air for the brakes to be used several times if the compressor stops working.
questions.answerC: Do not hold air unless there is an emergency.
questions.explanation: The air storage tanks in an air brake system store compressed air to be used for braking. They hold enough air for the brakes to still be used several times if the compressor stops working.

questions.question: An air compressor governor controls:
questions.answerA: When the air compressor pumps air into the air storage tanks.
questions.answerB: How fast air is pumped into the air storage tanks.
questions.answerC: The temperature of the air pumped into the air storage tanks.
questions.explanation: In an air brake system, the air compressor governor controls when the air compressor pumps air into the air storage tanks.

questions.question: Which of the following is not part of a vehicle’s air brake system?
questions.explanation: Components of an air brake system include an air compressor, an air compressor governor, air storage tanks, air tank drains, an alcohol evaporator, a safety valve, a brake pedal, foundation brakes, supply pressure gauges, an application pressure gauge, a low air pressure warning signal, a stop light switch, a front brake limiting valve (on some older vehicles), spring brakes, and parking brake controls.

questions.question: Brakes out of adjustment will:
questions.answerB: Cause some of the brakes to overwork and malfunction.
questions.explanation: Brakes out of adjustment will fade before those that are properly adjusted. Brake adjustment must be checked frequently to help prevent brake issues.

questions.question: Friction in an S-cam brake is caused when the brake shoes and linings:
questions.answerA: Press against the outside of the brake drum.
questions.answerB: Press against the inside of the brake drum.
questions.explanation: Friction inside a brake drum is caused when the brake shoes and linings push against the inside of the drum. The friction in the drums will slow and stop the vehicle.

questions.question: Using the brakes creates heat. If too much heat is produced:
questions.answerB: The brakes may squeak more than usual.
questions.explanation: Brakes are designed to take a lot of heat, but drivers should not rely solely on the brakes to slow their vehicle. Brakes may fade and lose their ability to slow down the vehicle if they become too hot, so drivers should also rely on the engine braking effect.

questions.question: In a vehicle with dual air brakes, a leak in one system ____ the second system.
questions.explanation: A dual air brake system is made up of two separate air brake systems. If there is an air leak in one system, it may not affect the other.

questions.question: If the low air pressure warning signal comes on, you should:
questions.answerA: Continue driving, but have the brakes repaired within a week.
questions.answerB: Pull over and inspect the brakes.
questions.explanation: If the low air pressure warning signal comes on while you are driving a vehicle with air brakes, you should immediately bring the vehicle to a safe stop while you are still able to control the brakes. Inspect and repair the brakes as soon as possible.

questions.question: A dual air brake system:
questions.answerA: Consists of two separate air brake systems that share a single set of controls.
questions.answerB: Is a single air brake system with two different sets of controls.
questions.answerC: Consists of one air brake system for the left side of the truck and one system for the right side of the truck, each with its own set of controls.
questions.explanation: A dual air brake system is made up of two separate air brake systems. The systems share a single set of brake controls, but each has its own air tanks, hoses, and lines. One system typically operates the regular brakes on the rear axle or axles while the other system operates the regular brakes on the front axle.

questions.question: During an applied leakage test, what is the maximum leakage rate that is safe for a single vehicle with air brakes?
questions.explanation: It is important to know the maximum air loss rate that is safe for your specific vehicle. A single vehicle with air brakes should have a leakage rate no higher than 3 psi in a minute during an applied leakage test.

questions.question: Air pressure should build up in a single air system within:
questions.explanation: In single air systems, air pressure should build from approximately 50 to 90 psi within three minutes.

questions.question: Lights that indicate that anti-lock brakes are not working are:
questions.explanation: Vehicles equipped with Anti-Lock Braking Systems (ABS) have yellow malfunction lights to indicate issues in the braking system.

questions.question: ABS brakes:
questions.answerC: Prevent your vehicle from accelerating when going uphill.
questions.explanation: The purpose of an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) is to prevent a vehicle's wheels from locking up when the driver brakes hard on a slippery surface.

questions.question: During an inspection, slack adjusters on S-cam brakes should not move more than:
questions.explanation: Check each slack adjuster after parking on level ground, setting wheel chocks, and disengaging the parking brake. Pull the slack adjusters to make sure they do not move more than about one inch from where the push rod is attached. If they move more than one inch, they may be out of adjustment and will need to be fixed.

questions.question: A wig wag is:
questions.answerB: A tube that carries air to the brakes.
questions.answerC: A type of air brake system.
questions.explanation: Vehicles with air brakes are required to be equipped with a low pressure warning device. A wig wag is a type of low air pressure warning device. This device drops a mechanical arm into the driver's view if the pressure in the tanks drops to a level between 55 and 75 psi.

questions.question: Before driving a vehicle with air brakes, you should ensure that the ____ come on automatically when air pressure falls below 45 psi.
questions.explanation: Before driving a vehicle with air brakes, you should ensure that the spring brakes come on automatically when air tank pressure falls to a level between 20 and 45 psi. You can do this by chocking the wheels and releasing air from the braking system by stepping on and off the brake pedal. Once the pressure levels drop to an unsafe level, the parking brake valve should pop out and spring brakes should come on.

questions.question: Having ABS on only one axle:
questions.answerB: Still allows you additional control when braking.
questions.answerC: Slows the vehicle, but cannot stop it.
questions.explanation: If you have an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) equipped on only the tractor, only the trailer, or only one axle, you will still have more control over the vehicle when braking than you would without ABS. You should brake normally.

questions.question: What do the two systems of a dual air brake system share?
questions.explanation: Both systems in a dual air brake systems share a single air compressor. If the air compressor is damaged, neither system will be able to operate properly.

questions.question: The leakage rate for a triple combination vehicle with air brakes should be no more than ____ in one minute during a static leakage test.
questions.explanation: When performing a static leakage test on a triple combination vehicle with air brakes, the leakage rate should be no more than 5 psi in one minute. If the air leaks from the air brake system at a quicker rate, the vehicle should not be driven because something likely needs to be repaired.

questions.question: What should happen before the air pressure in an air brake system tank falls below 55 psi?
questions.answerB: The vehicle will be unable to shift out of gear.
questions.explanation: The low air pressure warning signal must activate before the air supply pressure drops below 55 psi in the air tank. If the warning signal does not turn on when being tested during an inspection, the vehicle is not safe to drive.

questions.question: What can happen if the air pressure gets too low in an air brake system?
questions.explanation: Pressing and releasing the brake pedal unnecessarily can let air out of the braking system faster than the compressor can replace it. Air brakes may cease to work effectively if the pressure becomes too low.

questions.question: On flat surfaces, wheel chocks:
questions.answerA: Can be used to prevent a parked vehicle from moving.
questions.answerB: Make it easier for a parked vehicle to roll.
questions.answerC: Should only be used on the front driver's side tire.
questions.explanation: In situations where a driver cannot use a parking brake, wheel chocks can be used to hold a parked vehicle in place on a level surface.

questions.question: When parked on a flat surface, you should:
questions.answerA: Use wheel chocks to prevent your vehicle from moving.
questions.answerC: Use wheel chocks, but only if you have applied the parking brake.
questions.explanation: When parking on a level surface, you should use wheel chocks. If the vehicle is not equipped with spring brakes, this is essential to prevent the trailer from moving.

questions.question: An application pressure gauge shows:
questions.answerA: How much air pressure is being applied to the brakes.
questions.answerB: How much air pressure is available.
questions.answerC: How much air pressure is required to stop a vehicle.
questions.explanation: If a vehicle is equipped, an application pressure gauge shows how much air pressure is being applied to the brakes. This gauge can help a driver identify if their brakes are beginning to fade.

questions.question: If an air compressor is belt-driven, the belt should be routinely checked to ensure that it is:
questions.explanation: If your vehicle has air brakes, the air compressor drive belt should be checked before each drive. Check the tightness of the belt and verify that it is in good condition.

questions.question: Braking mechanisms are located inside:
questions.explanation: Drum brakes are attached to the wheels and located on the axles of a vehicle. The braking mechanisms that cause the vehicle to stop can be found inside of a drum brake.

questions.question: The ____ are activated by an electric switch that is triggered by the brake pedal.
questions.explanation: In a vehicle with air brakes, the brake lights are activated when the brake pedal is pushed and air pressure moves an electric switch. With the application of air pressure, the switch will then turn on the brake lights.

questions.question: During an applied leakage test, the maximum leakage rate for a triple combination vehicle is ____ in a minute.
questions.explanation: It is important to know the maximum air loss rate that is safe for your specific vehicle. A triple combination should have a leakage rate no higher than 6 psi in a minute during an applied leakage test.

questions.question: If using spring brakes when hauling a heavy load, a complete stop will:
questions.answerC: Take a short amount of time.
questions.explanation: Spring brakes do not work on all axles. If your vehicle's spring brakes activate due to low pressure in an air brake system, your vehicle will need a longer distance to stop than usual, especially if you are carrying a heavy load.

questions.question: If the safety relief valve in the air brake system releases air:
questions.answerB: The air pressure has become too high.
questions.explanation: An air brake system has a safety relief valve, which releases air from the tanks if the pressure gets too high. If the valve must operate, something in the system is wrong and should be addressed by a mechanic.

questions.question: What is often found in compressed air?
questions.explanation: Compressed air in an air brake system usually contains a certain amount of water and compressor oil. The water and oil can damage the brakes if left to accumulate in the system. Tanks must be drained regularly to remove this build-up.

questions.question: A safety valve is set to open at ____ pounds per square inch (psi).
questions.explanation: The safety valve protects air tanks and the rest of an air brake system from accumulating too much air pressure. The safety valve is usually set to open at 150 psi.

questions.question: Do not operate a vehicle if any brake drums have cracks that are larger than ____ of the width of the friction area.
questions.explanation: Before beginning a trip, it is important to check the brake drums during your walk-around inspection. It is unsafe to drive if any brake drum has a crack more than one half of the width of the friction area.

questions.question: The ____ between an air compressor and reservoir tank prevents air from escaping if the air compressor has a leak.
questions.explanation: A one-way check valve is required to be between an air compressor and the first main reservoir. This valve prevents air from escaping the system if the air compressor develops a leak.

questions.question: In a dual air brake system, air pressure should build from 85 to 100 psi within ____ seconds.
questions.explanation: When inspecting a vehicle with a dual air brake system, you should wait for air pressure to build from 85 to 100 psi in both the primary and secondary systems. This should take about 45 seconds.

questions.question: Having ABS on only one axle:
questions.answerB: Still allows you additional control when braking.
questions.answerC: Slows the vehicle, but cannot stop it.
questions.explanation: If you have an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) equipped on only the tractor, only the trailer, or only one axle, you will still have more control over the vehicle when braking than you would without ABS. You should brake normally.

questions.question: A wig wag is:
questions.answerB: A tube that carries air to the brakes.
questions.answerC: A type of air brake system.
questions.explanation: Vehicles with air brakes are required to be equipped with a low pressure warning device. A wig wag is a type of low air pressure warning device. This device drops a mechanical arm into the driver's view if the pressure in the tanks drops to a level between 55 and 75 psi.

questions.question: Using the brakes creates heat. If too much heat is produced:
questions.answerB: The brakes may squeak more than usual.
questions.explanation: Brakes are designed to take a lot of heat, but drivers should not rely solely on the brakes to slow their vehicle. Brakes may fade and lose their ability to slow down the vehicle if they become too hot, so drivers should also rely on the engine braking effect.

questions.question: During an applied leakage test, the maximum leakage rate for a double combination vehicle is ____ in a minute.
questions.explanation: It is important to know the maximum air loss rate that is safe for your specific vehicle. A double combination vehicle should have a leakage rate no higher than 4 psi in a minute during an applied leakage test.

questions.question: What do the two systems of a dual air brake system share?
questions.explanation: Both systems in a dual air brake systems share a single air compressor. If the air compressor is damaged, neither system will be able to operate properly.

questions.question: A low air pressure warning signal should activate:
questions.answerA: When tank pressure falls below 120 psi.
questions.answerB: When tank pressure falls below 60 psi.
questions.answerC: When tank pressure falls below 10 psi.
questions.explanation: In an air brake system, a low air pressure warning signal must come on if air pressure in the tanks falls below 60 psi. This warning signal may come in the form of a light, a buzzer, or a wig wag.

questions.question: When stopping in an emergency situation, you should:
questions.answerA: Veer your trailer to the right and stop.
questions.answerC: Veer your trailer to the left and stop.
questions.explanation: If you need to make an emergency stop, you can use either the controlled braking method or the stab braking method. It's important to brake in a way that keeps your vehicle in a straight line but will still allow you to turn if necessary.

questions.question: A dual air brake system:
questions.answerA: Consists of two separate air brake systems that share a single set of controls.
questions.answerB: Is a single air brake system with two different sets of controls.
questions.answerC: Consists of one air brake system for the left side of the truck and one system for the right side of the truck, each with its own set of controls.
questions.explanation: A dual air brake system is made up of two separate air brake systems. The systems share a single set of brake controls, but each has its own air tanks, hoses, and lines. One system typically operates the regular brakes on the rear axle or axles while the other system operates the regular brakes on the front axle.

questions.question: When experiencing cold weather, be sure to check your vehicle's alcohol evaporator:
questions.explanation: An alcohol evaporator can help prevent ice from building up in an air brake system. In cold weather, the evaporator should be checked and refilled every day.

questions.question: What color light indicates a vehicle's ABS is not working?
questions.explanation: On vehicles with Anti-Lock Braking Systems (ABS), yellow malfunction lamps alert the driver to ABS malfunction.

questions.question: When the spring brakes are on, you should never:
questions.explanation: Never push down the brake pedal while the spring brakes are activated. The combined force of springs and air pressure could damage the brakes.

questions.question: During a static leakage test, what is the maximum leakage rate that is safe for a double combination vehicle?
questions.explanation: When performing a static leakage test on a double combination vehicle with air brakes, the leakage rate should be no more than 3 psi in one minute. If the air leaks from the air brake system at a quicker rate, the vehicle should not be driven because something likely needs to be repaired.

questions.question: In a vehicle with dual air brakes, a leak in one system ____ the second system.
questions.explanation: A dual air brake system is made up of two separate air brake systems. If there is an air leak in one system, it may not affect the other.

questions.question: Why should you regularly drain the air tanks?
questions.answerA: Because the air gets old and needs to be replaced
questions.answerB: Because compressed air contains some water and the water collects in the tanks
questions.answerC: To allow for a change in pressure
questions.explanation: Compressed air usually contains a certain amount of moisture and compressor oil, which can build up in the air storage tanks and damage the brake system. The tanks should be drained to clean out these accumulations. On a tank with a manual drain valve, draining should be performed at the end of each day of driving.

questions.question: Older trailers are not equipped with spring brakes. This means that if the air supply for a vehicle's air braking system leaks away:
questions.answerB: The trailer will not have brakes.
questions.explanation: Older trailers do not have spring brakes. This means that if the air supply in an older trailer's air tank has leaked away, there will be no working brakes connected to the trailer and its wheels will turn freely.

questions.question: If your vehicle gets stuck on railroad tracks, you should:
questions.answerA: Sit in the cab and call for help.
questions.answerB: Exit the cab and walk away from the tracks.
questions.answerC: Motion for another driver to push your vehicle.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle gets stuck on railroad tracks for any reason, you should immediately exit the vehicle and walk away from the tracks. Contact the proper emergency authorities.

questions.question: Before a trip, you can make sure air flows to all trailers by:
questions.answerA: Checking for moving air inside of each trailer.
questions.answerB: Listening for air at the rear shut-off valve.
questions.answerC: Feeling for air at the front shut-off valve.
questions.explanation: Before a trip, ensure that air in the air brake system reaches all trailers. Do this by waiting for air pressure to build, then sending air to both the emergency and service lines and opening the shut-off valves on the rear of the last trailer. If air escapes from the shut-off valves in the rear of the combination, the air is being supplied to the entire vehicle.

questions.question: When driving a vehicle equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS), brakes should be applied:
questions.answerA: In the same way as they would be in a vehicle without ABS.
questions.answerB: As the vehicle is placed in neutral.
questions.explanation: When driving a vehicle with ABS, you should brake in the same manner as you would in a vehicle without ABS.

questions.question: When the wheels of a trailer lock up:
questions.explanation: A trailer may swing out and strike other vehicles if its wheels lock up. This is especially likely with lightly-loaded trailers.

questions.question: Operating combination vehicles usually requires ­­­­­____ operating single vehicles.
questions.answerB: About the same level of skill as
questions.explanation: Combination vehicles are usually heavier and longer than single combination vehicles. Operating a combination vehicle requires a higher level of driving skill than operating a single commercial vehicle.

questions.question: If color-coded, which color is used to identify emergency, or supply, lines?
questions.explanation: Air lines are sometimes color-coded to help drivers avoid mistakes when coupling glad hands. Typically, blue is used for service lines and red is used for emergency lines.

questions.question: During a trip, the ____ should be open.
questions.explanation: When starting a trip, be sure that all shut-off valves are in the open position, except for the last valves on the rear trailer. It is important that air reaches the brakes on all trailers and that it is not able to escape from the back of the vehicle.

questions.question: If a trailer begins to skid, it is best for the driver to:
questions.answerC: Quickly turn the steering wheel in one direction, then in the other.
questions.explanation: If your trailer begins to skid, you should release the brakes to regain traction. The trailer will begin to straighten out once the wheels begin to grip the road again.

questions.question: If you must cross traffic while driving a combination vehicle, you should:
questions.answerA: Assume other drivers will make room for your vehicle.
questions.answerB: Wait for a gap large enough for your vehicle to safely cross.
questions.explanation: Combination vehicles require more space on the road than other vehicles. When entering or crossing traffic while driving a combination vehicle, it is especially important that there is a large enonugh gap in traffic to safely do so.

questions.question: If a parked trailer does not have spring brakes, you should keep the trailer from moving by:
questions.answerA: Having the vehicle parked against a wall or other vehicle.
questions.explanation: If a parked trailer does not have spring brakes, wheel chocks should be used to prevent it from moving.

questions.question: Look into the back of the fifth wheel:
questions.answerB: If your vehicle begins to skid.
questions.explanation: While inspecting a coupling, you should go under the trailer and look into the back of the fifth wheel. Ensure that the fifth wheel jaws are secured around the shank of the kingpin.

questions.question: When coupling, after you've connected the air lines to the trailer, you should:
questions.explanation: Correctly following the steps to couple and uncouple trailers is vital to safely operating a combination vehicle. After connecting the air lines to the trailer while coupling, you should supply air to the trailer.

questions.question: What is the Johnson bar?
questions.answerA: A hand valve that works the trailer brakes
questions.answerB: A valve that indicates the fuel level
questions.answerC: A valve that limits the amount of cargo
questions.explanation: The trailer hand valve, also called the trolley valve or Johnson bar, is used to work the trailer brakes. It should be used only to test the brakes. Using it while a vehicle is in motion could cause a skid.

questions.question: The emergency air line supplies air to the:
questions.explanation: The emergency air line (also known as the supply line) has two functions. The first is to supply air to the trailer air tanks, and the second is to control the emergency brakes on combination vehicles.

questions.question: The trailer hand valve should be used:
questions.answerB: To check the connection between the trailer and tractor.
questions.explanation: The trailer hand valve (also referred to as the "trolley valve" or "Johnson bar") works the trailer brakes and should be used only when testing them. Using the trailer hand valve while driving could result in a skid.

questions.question: The trailer hand valve:
questions.answerA: Should always be used for parking.
questions.answerB: Should only be used for parking on a downgrade.
questions.answerC: Should never be used for parking.
questions.explanation: Never use the trailer hand valve while parking because doing so may release the air pressure  from the braking system, releasing the brakes that are holding the vehicle in place. Instead, use the parking brake or wheel chocks.

questions.question: Trailers built before ____ are not required to have spring brakes.
questions.explanation: Trailers built before 1975 are not required to have spring brakes. When parking a trailer without spring brakes, be sure to use wheel chocks to prevent the trailer from rolling.

questions.question: In a vehicle equipped with an automatic tractor protection valve, the valve will pop out when air pressure drops to a level between:
questions.explanation: In vehicles equipped with an automatic tractor protection valve, the valve will pop out if air pressure drops to a level between 20 and 45 psi. When the valve pops out, the protection valve will close, stopping the flow of air.

questions.question: The trailer hand valve should not be used while you are driving because:
questions.answerA: It will disconnect from the vehicle.
questions.answerB: You will stop the vehicle too quickly.
questions.explanation: Never use the trailer hand valve while operating your vehicle. Using the trailer hand valve while driving can cause your trailer to skid.

questions.question: Which of the following will not help prevent a rig from rolling over?
questions.answerA: Keeping the cargo as close to the ground as possible
questions.answerC: Driving on the shoulder of a road
questions.explanation: To help prevent a rig from rolling over, you should keep the weight of the cargo as close to the ground as possible when loading. You should also drive slowly around turns.

questions.question: How much space should be between the upper and lower fifth wheel?
questions.answerB: A maximum of two inches of space
questions.explanation: Before a trip, be sure to inspect all couplings. There should be no space between the upper and lower fifth wheel.

questions.question: Maintain a following distance of at least ____ for every 10 feet of your vehicle if you are traveling at a speed under 40 mph.
questions.explanation: At speeds below 40 mph, you should allow at least one second of following distance for every 10 feet of your vehicle. Follow the same formula when traveling at faster speeds, then add one additional second to your following distance. Remember that larger vehicles require more space to stop than smaller vehicles.

questions.question: If you use the trailer hand brake while your trailer is skidding, it will:
questions.explanation: If you are experiencing a trailer jackknife, you can help your tires regain traction by releasing the brakes. Using a trailer hand brake while experiencing a skid will only cause the skid to continue.

questions.question: In an empty combination vehicle, the stiff suspension springs and strong brakes will have:
questions.explanation: An empty combination vehicle will come to a complete stop more slowly than a fully-loaded vehicle. With less weight in a trailer, the stiff suspension springs and strong brakes will have lower traction than they would if the vehicle carried more weight.

questions.question: The trailer hand valve:
questions.answerA: Should always be used for parking.
questions.answerB: Should only be used for parking on a downgrade.
questions.answerC: Should never be used for parking.
questions.explanation: Never use the trailer hand valve while parking because doing so may release the air pressure  from the braking system, releasing the brakes that are holding the vehicle in place. Instead, use the parking brake or wheel chocks.

questions.question: Keeping cargo low can:
questions.explanation: Rollovers can happen when a combination vehicle is turned too quickly. To help prevent the risk of rollover, it is important to keep the vehicle's center of gravity low by loading cargo as close to the ground as possible.

questions.question: If you cannot reverse your trailer in a straight path, you should:
questions.answerA: Swerve back and forth while backing.
questions.explanation: If you need to back your trailer but cannot back up in a straight path, you should back on a curved path toward the driver's side of the vehicle. This will allow you the best possible visibility while backing.

questions.question: If the emergency air line loses pressure:
questions.answerA: The Anti-Lock Braking System will activate.
questions.answerB: The service air line will activate.
questions.explanation: The emergency air line controls the emergency brakes on a combination vehicle. A loss of air pressure in the emergency line will cause the emergency trailer brakes to activate.

questions.question: A driver should test the tractor protection valve by:
questions.answerB: Releasing air with the brake pedal.
questions.explanation: You should test the tractor protection valve by allowing the air supply to properly charge, turning off the engine, then releasing air from the system by pressing the brake pedal several times. The tractor protection valve should move into its emergency position when psi drops to an unsafe level.

questions.question: If you are backing and the trailer begins to drift off-course, the driver should:
questions.answerA: Return the steering wheel to the 12 o’clock position.
questions.answerB: Turn the top of the steering wheel in the direction of the drift.
questions.answerC: Turn the top of the steering wheel in the direction opposite of the drift.
questions.explanation: If your trailer begins to drift while you are backing, you should correct the drift immediately by turning the top of the steering wheel in the direction of the drift.

questions.question: What does an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) do?
questions.answerA: It allows a vehicle's wheels to lock up.
questions.answerB: It prevents a vehicle's wheels from locking up.
questions.answerC: It makes turning a vehicle easier.
questions.explanation: An Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) helps prevent wheel lockup during hard braking. If ABS detects impending lockup, it reduces braking pressure to a safe level.

questions.question: If your vehicle gets stuck on railroad tracks, you should:
questions.answerA: Sit in the cab and call for help.
questions.answerB: Exit the cab and walk away from the tracks.
questions.answerC: Motion for another driver to push your vehicle.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle gets stuck on railroad tracks for any reason, you should immediately exit the vehicle and walk away from the tracks. Contact the proper emergency authorities.

questions.question: If a parked trailer does not have spring brakes, you should keep the trailer from moving by:
questions.answerA: Having the vehicle parked against a wall or other vehicle.
questions.explanation: If a parked trailer does not have spring brakes, wheel chocks should be used to prevent it from moving.

questions.question: If color-coded, which color is used to identify emergency, or supply, lines?
questions.explanation: Air lines are sometimes color-coded to help drivers avoid mistakes when coupling glad hands. Typically, blue is used for service lines and red is used for emergency lines.

questions.question: Place the trailer air supply control in its "emergency" position to test:
questions.explanation: Be sure to test the trailer emergency brakes before beginning a trip. After ensuring that the trailer rolls freely, you can test the emergency brakes by pulling out the trailer air supply control, or placing it in the "emergency" position. Pull forward slightly with the tractor and make sure the trailer does not move.

questions.question: If a trailer begins to skid, it is best for the driver to:
questions.answerC: Quickly turn the steering wheel in one direction, then in the other.
questions.explanation: If your trailer begins to skid, you should release the brakes to regain traction. The trailer will begin to straighten out once the wheels begin to grip the road again.

questions.question: Watching the road ahead:
questions.answerA: Is more dangerous than only watching your mirrors.
questions.answerB: Does not help you drive more safely.
questions.answerC: Can help you avoid the need for sudden lane changes.
questions.explanation: Making a sudden lane change can be dangerous while driving a combination vehicle. You can avoid the need to make a sudden lange change by looking down the road for upcoming obstacles that will require you to change lanes.

questions.question: When the wheels of a trailer lock up:
questions.explanation: A trailer may swing out and strike other vehicles if its wheels lock up. This is especially likely with lightly-loaded trailers.

questions.question: The ____ trailer is the most likely to turn over if a driver takes a turn too quickly.
questions.explanation: When making a turn, be sure to steer gently and smoothly. Making a quick turn while pulling trailers is dangerous and can increase the risk of the last trailer rolling over.
